content.description: Follow the middle of the face up through what appear to be easy holds. Watch out for those sucker holds... Route #7 on Short Stack on 2019 guide.
Check out the teaching station to practice setting a belay from fixed anchors and also for cleaning anchors.
content.location: The station is low on the face opposite The Brutal Block.

content.description: Start 10' right of Unnamed 5.9 trad route using the obvious holds directly to the top.
content.location: Route #6 on Short Stack on 2019 guide.

content.description: This route was originally done as a trad route up the obvious dihedral.  Bolts were added for safety and to also increase traffic on this fun line.
content.protection: Standard trad rack to practice gear, or bolts.
content.location: Route #3 on Short Stack on 2019 guide.

content.description: This is the left variation of Slope Stone
content.location: Left of Slope Stone Right. Route #4 on Short Stack on 2019 guide.

content.description: Climb the face up to a large horizontal and place some gear. Heel hook and crank/ lunge to the crescent shaped ledge. Follow the flake past the bolt to the top.
content.location:
Route is located on the right end of the face. Right of Reunion.

 Route #8 on Short Stack on 2019 guide.

content.description: This is a great route for the Lost Crag.  Fairly continuous climbing.  Start on some small holds to reach a nice flake and reach for the large horizontal.  Place some gear here.  Reach up to a 2 finger pocket, pull up to gain a stance and clip the bolt.  Now the crux begins...all the way to the finish.  The last moves are very reminiscent of the New River Gorge.
content.location: This route is located in the center of the orange face on the Shortstack directly under the shuts. Route #9 on Short Stack on 2019 guide.
There are rap rings atop the face that is directly opposite Brutal Block.  These will allow you to get off of "Evil Edge" and "Psycho Driller" which both have top anchors on top of the block.

content.description: Follows the wandering line of 3 bolts up the back side of The Short Stack. This climb was bolted on lead by Norm Reed to gain access to the top of the block. Popular route at the Lost Crag.
content.protection: 3 bolts.  Note that the anchors for this climb are over the top of the block.  If you want to set a top rope for your second, you will have to bring two 24" slings to extend over the edge.   There is a rap station to get off of this block that is just around the right side of the arete.  You can see them from the ground if you walk around the corner of the block.
content.location: Route #2 on Short Stack on 2019 guide.

content.description: Start at the low overhang under the arete to the left of Reunion.  Climb up to reach a jug and horizontal crack about half way up.  Plug some gear here.  Gain a stance, reach for the lip and top it out.  The top out is interesting.
content.location: This route climbs the arete to the left of Reunion. Route #10 on Short Stack on 2019 guide.

content.description: Climb a line 6' right of Slopers in the Rain. Climb up dirty, but useful handholds placing resonable protection on the way. Exit to the left at the top. Route #5 on Short Stack on 2019 guide.

This is one of the nicest routes at the grade at The Lost Crag. Climb up the blocky start, avoiding the large ledge to the left. Head for the clean arete, gaining a stance at its base. Use the arete to make a reachy move to the very positive top edge. Top it out.
content.protection: 3 bolts.  Note the the anchors for this climb are over the top of the block.  If you want to set a top rope for your second, you will have to bring two 24" slings to extend over the edge.   There is a rap station to get off of this block that is just around the right side of the arete.  You can see them from the ground if you walk around the corner of the block.
content.location: The right arete on the side of the Shortstack opposite the Reunion face. Route #1 on Short Stack on 2019 guide.

content.description: The front and back sides of this block have high quality routes on it.  On the front, The Left Arete is a fun route, and Reunion, 5.11d, mixed, is an area classic.  The three 8's and the 9 on the opposite side are all great moderate routes right next to each other.  The routes on the downhill side of the block have seen little traffic and might need some brushing.
